jzombies.defender

Class SecurityPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • jzombies.defender.SecurityPolicy

  • public class SecurityPolicy
extends java.lang.Object
    Security policy represent a rule that enforced on the incoming requests for a specific end point.
    Author:
    User-Zero

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecurityPolicy

        public SecurityPolicy(EndPoint endPoint,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Action> truePortionActionList,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Action> falsePortionActionList)
        Parameterized constructor
        Parameters:
        endPoint - The end point that this security policy will be enforced on.
        truePortionActionList - The action(s) in case the request met the security policy.
        falsePortionActionList - The action(s) in case the request doesn't meet the security policy.

      • addCondition

        public void addCondition(Condition condition)
        Using this function you can create security rule with multiple conditions, but you have to send list of operations in case more than one condition get used.
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition

      • enforce

        public java.util.ArrayList<Action> enforce(Request req)
        This function will verify it certain request meet a security policy
        Parameters:
        req - In coming request
        Returns:
        return True if the request met the rule(s) otherwise false.

      • setOperationList

        public void setOperationList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> op)
        In case of multiple conditions, list of the operators must be given
        Parameters:
        op - List of operators [& or |]
